# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(input_str, text_width = 10)
    words = split(input_str, ' ') # Split into words
    wrapped_lines = []

    for word in words
        if length(string(word)) > text_width
            push!(wrapped_lines, string(word) '\n'))
        else
            push!(wrapped_lines, word))
        end
    end

    return join(wrapped_lines), '')
end

# Example usage
input_str = "This is a long sentence that exceeds the maximum text width of 10 characters per line."
wrapped_output = wrap_string(input_str)
println(wrapped_output)
```
In this example, the `wrap_string` function takes an input string and a maximum `text_width`. It splits the input into words, checks if each word exceeds the text width, and wraps it with a newline. The final wrapped output is returned as a single string.
